channel.title: Dpi on OONI: Open Observatory of Network Interference
channel.description: Recent content in Dpi on OONI: Open Observatory of Network Interference

item.title: Ethiopia: Evidence of social media blocking and internet censorship
item.description: Youth in Addis trying to get Wi-Fi Connection. Credit Addis Fortune Newspaper Recently we published a post about what appeared to be a possible internet shutdown in Ethiopia during a wave of ongoing protests by ethnic groups. Today, in collaboration with Amnesty International we are releasing a report that includes evidence of recent censorship events during Ethiopiaâ€™s political upheaval. View the pdf version of the report here. Country: Ethiopia

item.title: Egypt: Media censorship, Tor interference, HTTPS throttling and ads injections?
item.description: Country: Egypt Probed ISPs: Noor (AS 20928), TE Data (AS 8452), Vodafone (AS 24835) Censorship method: DPI, network throttling, TCP injections OONI tests: HTTP Requests, Web Connectivity, Vanilla Tor Measurement period: 2016-08-27 - 2016-10-26 We recently noticed network anomalies in Egypt and performed a study in an attempt to understand the situation. Our findings indicate that the Tor anonymity network appeared to be interfered with in Egypt, while HTTPS connections to DigitalOcean’s Frankfurt data centre were throttled.

item.title: EEEP and Greek Internet censorship
item.description: Country: Greece Probed ISPs: Forthnet, Ote, Cyta, Wind, Vodafone, Cosmote, Wind mobile Blocking methods: DPI, DNS Hijacking, HTTP proxy Measurement period: June - July 2014 19:40 UTC Saturday, 17 June 2016 Update: Add AS numbers of the ISPs, update raw measurement data URLs. The newly formed Independent Administrative Authority’s Hellenic Gaming Commission acts as the public body responsible for the control and supervision of gambling services in Greece and published a blacklist of websites that are offering unlicensed gambling and betting services to Greek internet users.
